Dog - Part 1" || May 1, 2007 |- | align="center" |'''20''' || "My Favourite Dog - Part 2" || May 8, 2007 |- | align="center" |'''21''' || "Rules of the Road - Part 1" || May 14, 2007 |- | align="center" |'''22''' || "Rules of the Road - Part 2" || May 15, 2007 |- | align="center" |'''23''' || "The Sorrow of Bernice" || May 21, 2007 |- | align="center" |'''24''' || "The Zoo" || May 22, 2007 |- | align="center" |'''25''' || "Thanks for the Memories - Part 1" || May 28, 2007 |- | align="center" |'''26''' || "Thanks for the Memories - Part 2" || June 4, 2007 |} ==Broadcast== ''Z-Squad'' first aired in [[South Korea]] on [[Seoul Broadcasting System|SBS]] between December 2006 and June 2007. The series was later broadcast on Champ, [[Cartoon Network (South Korea)|Cartoon Network]], Anione and KT IPTV.{{Cite web|url=https://www.corusent.com/news/schoolgirl-super-heroines-of-the-z-squad-poised-for-action-at-mipcom/|title=Schoolgirl Super Heroines Of The Z-Squad Poised For Action At MIPCOM|publisher=[[Nelvana Limited]] (Press release)|date=2007-09-26|accessdate=2018-10-24}} The show had its English-language debut on [[Pop Girl]] in the [[United Kingdom]] in late 2008. Along with ''[[Di-Gata Defenders]]'', ''Z-Squad'' was introduced as part of the [[Syfy Kids]] block on the multi-national [[KidsCo]] network in June 2013.{{Cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/kidsco-launch-syfy-kids-genre-431290|title=KidsCo to Launch Syfy Kids Genre Block In June|last=Vlessing|first=Etan|publisher=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=2013-03-27|accessdate=2018-10-24}} “The joint venture between NBCUniversal International and Canada’s Corus Entertainment has acquired a slew of kids titles for the Syfy Kids offering, including a first-run exclusive of Zuzu & the Supernuffs from Matchbox Pictures, and Nelvana Enterprises’ Di-Gata Defenders and Z-Squad series.” It was also one of the shows included when [[NBC]] ported Syfy Kids to Asia the following month.{{Cite web|url=http://kidscreen.com/2013/04/16/kidsco-sends-syfy-kids-to-asia/|title=KidsCo sends new Syfy block to Asia|last=Ng-See-Quan|first=Danielle|publisher=[[KidScreen]]|date=2013-04-16|accessdate=2018-10-24}} “The Syfy Kids block will launch with a first-run exclusive of its original production Zuzu & the Supernuffs from Matchbox Pictures. It will also feature the CG-animated Matt Hatter Chronicles, produced by Platinum Films and Toronto’s Dream Mill, with animation by Arc Productions; Z-Squad, from Corus’ Nelvana Enterprises and Enemes, and the Back to the Future animated series.” It was aimed at ages 6–10.{{Cite web|url=http://kidscreen.com/2013/08/20/kidsco-acquires-sendokai-champions/|title=KidsCo acquires Sendokai Champions|last=Rusak|first=Gary|publisher=KidScreen|date=2013-08-20|accessdate=2018-10-24}} “The fully dubbed block airs at peak viewing times and targets a kids aged 6-10. demo Key titles on the block include: Matt Hatter Chronicles, ZuZu & the Supernuffs, Z-Squad, The Future is Wild, Back to the Future and The Mummy.” Initial plans for a [[North America]]n broadcast reportedly included [[YTV (TV channel)|YTV]] and [[Teletoon]] in [[Canada]], with [[Disney Channel]] on board in the [[United States]].{{cite web|url=https://www.hancinema.net/-crystal-fairy-z-squad-wins-at-asian-tv-awards-11643.html|title='Crystal Fairy Z-Squad' wins at Asian TV Awards|publisher=Han Cinema|date=2007-12-05|accessdate=2018-10-24}} However, the show would never air on linear television in either market, instead being limited to [[video-on-demand]] platforms. In Canada, the series was included as part of the Kids Suite service for [[Rogers Cable]] customers in 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.rogersondemand.com/OnDemand/Show/z_squad?lang=en|title=Z-Squad|publisher=RogersOnDemand.Com|accessdate=2018-10-24|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140710053212/http://www.rogersondemand.com/OnDemand/Show/z_squad?lang=en|archivedate=July 10, 2014}} In the United States, ''Z-Squad'' is available to purchase on [[Amazon Video]] and stream on [[Tubi TV]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Z-Squad/dp/B00G03QGMM|title=Amazon.com: Z-Squad|publisher=[[Amazon.com]]|accessdate=2018-10-24}}{{Cite web|url=https://tubitv.com/series/2408/z_squad|title=Watch Z-Squad Online for Free|publisher=[[Tubi TV]]|accessdate=2018-10-24}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070212023102/http://z-squad.co.kr/ Official Korean website] at the [[Wayback Machine]] (archived February 12, 2007) * [http://www.nelvana.com/show/193/z-squad Z-Squad] at Nelvana.com * {{IMDb title|0813977|Z-Squad}} [[Category:2000s South Korean animated television series]] [[Category:2006 South Korean television series debuts]] [[Category:2007 South Korean television series endings]] [[Category:2000s Canadian animated television series]] [[Category:2008 Canadian television series debuts]] [[Category:2008 Canadian television series endings]] [[Category:Seoul Broadcasting System television programmes]] [[Category:Computer-animated television series]] [[Category:Canadian children's animated action television series]] [[Category:Canadian children's animated adventure television series]] [[Category:Korean-language television programs]] [[Category:Magical girl television series]] [[Category:English-language television programs]] [[Category:Television series by Nelvana]]
